title: Twitter Is Outraged Over Donald Trump's Reversal of Transgender Bathroom Guidelines
text:
Twitter Is Outraged Over Donald Trump's Reversal of Transgender Bathroom Guidelines By Facebook PHOTO: Saul Loeb/Getty Images 
On Wednesday, the Trump administration officially revoked federal anti-discrimination protections for transgender students, which specified that they have the right to use the bathroom corresponding to their gender identity in public schools. The backlash online was swift. 
The measure was enacted by President Obama, who wrote in a letter last May that all schools receiving federal funds must allow transgender students to use the bathroom of their choice, based on the Obama administration's interpretation that Title IX, the law banning sex discrimination in schools, covers gender identity. In rescinding the Obama-era policy, the Trump administration issued its own letter to federally funded schools telling them to disregard previous orders stipulating that previous directives regarding the issue have been withdrawn without offering new guidance going forward. 
According to a Tuesday briefing from White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer, the Trump administration holds the belief that "bathroom debate" should be left to state legislators , not the federal government. 
Many, including actors, musicians, celebrities and other prominent figures, took to social media to condemn Trump's actions and declare their support for the transgender community in the wake of the Trump administration's announcement of the roll back.
